Articles.Content:
I find it silly that KSP is missing the absolute most basic form of science that is used by Humans: photography. There are so many possibilities with adding this piece of science equipment to the game ... can you imagine how cool it would be to have a museum (or just added to the page in the R&D facility) on Kerbal Space Center that feature RETURNED surface samples and photographs from missions? These could even be canned photographs from say "low orbit", "high orbit" and "surface" to match the current biomes.

Edited April 16, 2014 by Caelib
That's on the "already suggested" list. But I agree, that is a pretty obvious thing to add.
There is the RPM camera, and another mod (StationScience, possibly) which add cameras viewable from capsules, and science cameras.
I've wanted a camera for a long time, but I never thought of having it linked to a museum! Man, that would be so cool, and the functionality is almost there with the science archives.
Perhaps the tracking station would have blurry images until images were taken.

Perhaps the tracking station would have blurry images until images were taken.

I love you.

I love you.

I see you as a friend....
